content:
Yes, some of the farmers' markets in Guangzhou have street food stalls or vendors selling ready-to-eat snacks. Here are a few examples:

1. Baijia Wholesale Market: This market has several food stalls and vendors selling local snacks such as BBQ skewers, steamed buns, and noodles. 

2. Fangcun Farmers' Market: This market is known for its street food and offers a wide variety of snacks such as steamed dumplings, roasted sweet potatoes, and fried spring rolls. 

3. Litchi Bay Market: This market also has several food stalls and vendors selling local snacks, such as roasted chestnuts, fried noodles, and fruit smoothies.

4. Guangzhou Daily Fresh Market: This market has a food court that offers a large selection of ready-to-eat snacks, including dim sum, noodles, and grilled seafood.

Please note that these street food stalls may not have the same hygiene standards as restaurants, so it is important to exercise caution and choose food vendors carefully. It is recommended that you stick to hot, freshly cooked food and avoid street food that has been precooked and left out in the open for long periods.
